column2: ENGLISH
Enrolled in school
This person is being educated at a private institution
Send to school
Enroll your child in a public school to further their education
It will soon be time for [FromFrom.GetFirstName] to take the yearly exam at school. You sternly advise [FromFrom.GetHerHim] to study while you get back to your business of ruling.
On second thought, you can stay home if you want
Keep your child out of school to avoid stressing them. This will probably not help in the long run
Give it your all, my child!
Your child will study for a few nights to prepare for the exam. Wish them luck
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has excelled at the exam. They scored high honors and even impressed one of their peers.
You make our family proud!
Your child performed well on the exam, but [FromFrom.GetHerHis] instructors report to you that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has a tendency to slack off during instruction.
No more lollygagging! Time to study!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] scored well on the exam, but there is room for improvement. [FromFrom.GetHerHis] instructors tell you that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is on the right track.
Good.

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] scored very poorly on [FromFrom.GetHerHis] exam. The instructors tell you that [FromFrom.GetFirstName] needs to study harder or they will fall behind. Obviously, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] didn't take the low score too well.
Embarrassing! Do better next time!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] performed better on the exam than anyone could believe! [FromFrom.GetSheHe] received the highest score on the test and an accolade from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] teachers.
Greatness comes natural to my kin!

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has finally graduated from school! You attend the graduation ceremony, looking on with pride as [FromFrom.GetFirstName] recieves [FromFrom.GetHerHis] graduation parchment. As their guardian, you have some say in what path [FromFrom.GetFirstName] chooses.
History, Economics, and Humanities
You choose a more History and Humanities focused degree for your child
Art, Literature, and Philosophy
You choose a more literary and artistic path for your child
